headline: Kentucky introduces new COVID-19 guidance to match CDC's: What to know
sentences:
This chart explains:
There is also some new guidance for schools on masks:
Soon, Kentucky's incidence rate maps on the COVID-19 website will be changed to reflect new mapping by the CDC to show a community level map â€” which will align with the guidance above.

The new guidelines emphasize the importance of vaccines and booster, and isolating while sick, but also stops recommending masks unless you're in an area where there is still a high level of community spread.
Kentucky is updating its COVID-19 guidance to match the latest recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Most of Kentucky's counties are still high as of Monday, but Dr. Steven Stack predicts that'll change soon.
Beshear also announced Monday that masks will be optional in state buildings starting on Tuesday.
You'll be able to find it here when the state makes the switch.
